snippet: President Obama’s standing has undoubtedly suffered from recent turmoil over Syria and American spying, even though he can point to a strengthening economy.
abstract: Pres Obama heads to Group of Twenty summit in Russia facing questions about his leadership and his policies at home and abroad; Obama's standing has suffered from turmoil over Syria and American spying, even though he can point to strengthening economy.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Ellen Barry from New Delhi, Simon Romero from Rio de Janeiro, Jane Perlez from Beijing, Elisabeth Malkin and Karla Zabludovsky from Mexico City, and David M. Herszenhorn and Noah Sneider from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: President Obama’s standing has undoubtedly suffered from recent turmoil over Syria and American spying, even though he can point to a strengthening economy.

headline.main: Questions of Policy and Leadership Dog Obama Before Meeting in Russia
headline.print_headline: Questions of Policy and Leadership Dog Obama Before Meeting in Russia
